snippet: The campaign was prompted by the murder of a woman at a McDonald’s that horrified the nation and was attributed to adherents of a religious group.
abstract: China cracks down on religious cults after woman is beaten and kicked to death when refusing to give her information to members of Christian sect on aggressive recruitment drive; state-run publications have produced a steady drumbeat of alarming articles to fan public's outrage; decades of propaganda attacks against such groups have convinced much of public that adherents of so-called cults deserve little sympathy.
lead_paragraph: The campaign was prompted by the murder of a woman at a McDonald’s that horrified the nation and was attributed to adherents of a religious group.

headline.main: Campaign to Crack Down on Fringe Sects in China Worries Mainstream Churches
